file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 33-47-03-04 - STROBE LIGHTS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL STROBE LIGHTS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the Strobe Lights. B. There are three strobe lights. They are installed one in each wing tip and the other on the vertical/ horizontal empennage fairing (tail boom). C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 33-47-03-000-801-A STROBE LIGHTS - REMOVAL ALL 33-47-03-400-801-A STROBE LIGHTS - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 33-47-03 Page 1 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-47-03-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. STROBE LIGHTS - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the Strobe Lights. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 55-36-01-000-801-A/400 TAIL-BOOM LIGHT LENS - REMOVAL AMM TASK 57-30-01-000-801-A/400 - S.B.145-33-0008 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 561 561AL Wing tip 661 661AR Wing tip Vertical/horizontal empennage fairing 321 (tail boom) D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Wing tips and vertical/horizontal empen- 1 Does the task nage fairing (tail boom) I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the STROBE switch, on the overhead panel, is in the OFF position. (2) Remove the wing tip lens (AMM TASK 57-30-01-000-801-A/400). (3) Remove the tail boom lens ( AMM TASK 55-36-01-000-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-47-03 Page 2 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) (PRE-MOD S.B.145-33-0008) Remove the strobe lights as follows (Figure 401): (a) FOR AIRCRAFT WITH STROBE LIGHT REFLECTOR, do as follows: 1 Remove the two screws (4) and two washers (3) that attach the strobe light reflector. 2 Remove the strobe light reflector (7). 3 Remove the lens retainer (2). 4 Remove the lens (5). 5 Pull the lamp base (6) to get access to the electrical connector (1). 6 Hold the lamp base (6) and turn the electrical connector (1) to disconnect it. 7 Remove the strobe light. (b) FOR AIRCRAFT WITHOUT STROBE LIGHT REFLECTOR, do as follows: 1 Remove the two screws (4) and two washers (3) that attach the lens retainer (2). 2 Remove the lens retainer (2). 3 Remove the lens (5). 4 Pull the lamp base (6) to get access to the electrical connector (1). 5 Hold the lamp base (6) and turn the electrical connector (1) to disconnect it. 6 Remove the strobe light. (2) (POST-MOD S.B.145-33-0008) Remove the strobe lights as follows: NOTE: For aircraft without standby tail navigation lights refer to Figure 402. For aircraft with standby tail navigation lights refer to Figure 403. (a) For the removal of the wing tip strobe light, do as follows: 1 Remove the three screws (1), three lock washers (2), and three washers (3) which attach the strobe light (4) to the adapter (6). 2 Pull the strobe light (4) sufficiently to get access to the electrical connector (5). 3 Disconnect the electrical connector (5) and remove the strobe light (4). (b) For the removal of the tail-boom strobe light, do as follows: 1 Remove the four screws (7), four lock washers (8), and four washers (9) which attach the strobe light (10) to the adapter (12). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-47-03 Page 3 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL 2 Pull the strobe light (10) sufficiently to get access to the electrical connector (11). 3 Disconnect the electrical connector (11) and remove the strobe light (10). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-47-03 Page 4 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-47-03-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. STROBE LIGHTS - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the Strobe Lights. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 33-47-00-700-801-A/500 ANTICOLLISION LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL TEST AMM TASK 55-36-01-400-801-A/400 TAIL-BOOM LIGHT LENS - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 57-30-01-400-801-A/400 - S.B.145-33-0008 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 561 561AL Wing tip 661 661AR Wing tip 321 Vertical/horizontal empennage fairing D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE At the left and right wing tips and at the 1 Does the task vertical/horizontal fairing I. Installation SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) (PRE-MOD S.B.145-33-0008) Install the strobe lights as follows (Figure 401): (a) FOR AIRCRAFT WITH STROBE LIGHT REFLECTOR, do as follows: 1 Put the strobe light in its installation position. 2 Connect the electrical connector (1) to the lamp base (6). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-47-03 Page 8 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL 3 Install the lens (5). 4 Install the lens retainer (2). 5 Install the strobe light reflector (7). 6 Put the two washers (3) and two screws (4) in their installation position. 7 Tighten the two screws (4). (b) FOR AIRCRAFT WITHOUT STROBE LIGHT REFLECTOR, do as follows: 1 Put the strobe light in its installation position. 2 Connect the electrical connector (1) to the lamp base (6). 3 Install the lens (5). 4 Install the lens retainer (2). 5 Put the two washers (3) and two screws (4) in their installation position. 6 Tighten the two screws (4). (2) (POST-MOD S.B.145-33-0008) Install the strobe lights as follows: NOTE: For aircraft without standby tail navigation lights refer to Figure 402. For aircraft with standby tail navigation lights refer to Figure 403. (a) For the installation of the wing tip strobe light, do as follows: 1 Connect the electrical connector (5). 2 Put the strobe light (4) in its installation position. 3 Tighten the three screws (1), three lock washers (2), and three washers (3) which attach the strobe light (4) to the adapter (6). (b) For the installation of the tail boom strobe light, do as follows: 1 Connect the electrical connector (11). 2 Put the strobe light (10) in its installation position. 3 Tighten the four screws (7), four lock washers (8), and four washers (9) which attach the strobe light (10) to the adapter (12). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Do the operational test of the Strobe Lights ( AMM TASK 33-47-00-700-801-A/500). (2) Install the wing tip lens (AMM TASK 57-30-01-400-801-A/400). (3) Install the tail boom lens ( AMM TASK 55-36-01-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-47-03 Page 9 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A.
